prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would. What is the greatest common divisor of $7979$ and $3713$?
solution:
We can use the Euclidean Algorithm to find the greatest common divisor of these two integers. \begin{align*}
\gcd(7979, 3713) &= \gcd(3713, 7979 - 2\cdot 3713) \\
&= \gcd(3713, 553) \\
&= \gcd(553, 3713 - 6\cdot 553) \\
&= \gcd(553, 395) \\
&= \gcd(395, 553 - 395) \\
&= \gcd(395, 158) \\
&= \gcd(158, 395- 2\cdot 158) \\
&= \gcd(158, 79) \\
&= \boxed{79}.
\end{align*}
gpt_response:
To find the greatest common divisor, we need to find the largest number that can divide both $7979$ and $3713$ without leaving a remainder.

We can start by listing the factors of each number and finding the common factors:

Factors of $7979$: $1, 7, 113, 889, 7979$
Factors of $3713$: $1, 19, 59, 197, 3713$

The common factors of $7979$ and $3713$ are $1$. So, the greatest common divisor of $7979$ and $3713$ is $1$.
